title: So Conqueror is meant to be anti tank right?
body:
Let’s take Conqueror against everything. Even if there are no tanks in the game, let’s still take Conqueror.

Oh you built Ninja Tabi and Thornmail to counter Trynda or Jax, it doesn’t matter because Conqueror will make that armor useless.

Oh you build Zhonya’s to try and counter Zed, Conqueror will make that armor useless.

Let’s take Conqueror and destroy tanks at all stages of the game. Let’s take Conqueror and overkill squishy champions. 

Full tanks cannot tank anymore. Squishy champs that build one armor item still die just as quick while making the armor item useless.

Other keystones average around 1000 damage all game and these keystones are adaptive damage and have cooldowns. Conqueror can achieve more than 7000 damage all game with no downtime and it deals true damage. But what gets nerfed? The other keystones. Conqueror only had a -4AD nerf at level 1.

replies.body: zed conqueror? lol.
change it from true damage conversion to 20% armor+magic pen and we are good.

Sure, but make it scaling and possibly function like this: (Numbers need some tuning)
Any time you attack a champion, you gain a stack of the rune, which grants 2% adaptive pen (armor or magic depending on your main stat), up to like 8 stacks (and the bonuses be halved on ranged). Lasts 4 seconds, refreshes when in combat with enemy champ.
That way there is an actual opening you can fight the user before they are at full strength. Also makes it so they cant just sit on minion waves and stack it, they have to be fighting the enemy champ to stack it.

They are, actually.  Tanks are weak to sustained damage, which Marksmen and Fighters inflict.

> The problem before was that brusiers never could kill tanks.

Ok, pointing this out real quick. If a fighter is building damage items in a way to deal a lot of up front damage, why should they kill a tank? Why should 0 investment in % armor pen or shred mean anyone should be able to kill tanks? Yes, sustained damage is better against tanks, but you should still have to build to handle them and not just get handed a rune that allows you to kill them easily while building to deal more burst damage. You shouldn’t be able to kill both easily. Want to be able to kill a tank without it? How about Cleaver/Whisper, attack speed, PtA?

Let’s also not forget that Conquerer encourages stacking on minions before even fighting so you have an instant advantage, and so discourages trading.

Similar issue to things like old Q crit Vayne and the high burst adcs had at one point. 

Tanks have been dealing more damage, and that’s an issue. Tanks are getting more damage and less defensives, which is also a massive issue. But that doesn’t mean you should introduce another horrible mechanic just to Correct an issue.

Edit: fighters are fine to want their own rune, but many seemed to want, or at least do now, Fervor back, because it was a better designed keystone than Conquerer will likely ever be.

But where did OP state it was from a long game? 

The OP purposely structured his phrasing to make it seem Conqueror repeatedly does 7K damage regularly in a game. I can see an outlier where this occurs but he specifically nitpicked at a rare, worst-case scenario case and paired it with a regular occurrence to bolster his weak argument. I dislike Conqueror with a passion but this post is a useless one that contributes nothing to addressing the issue.

Edit: OP said Conqueror can exceed 7K damage "all" game so he is stating this is a regular occurrence. He also says it has no downtime, which is false. It's just extremely easy to ramp especially on its core abusers.

In addition, the reason Conqueror is OP is because of the bonus AD it provides WITH the 20% true damage. The true damage amplifies abilities too much and with the AD on top, it disintegrates everyone from tanks to squishies due to autoattacks coming in with the abilities. The rune would be horrible without the AD and mediocre without the true damage. 

Both bonuses create this huge damage scale that defeats armor penetration which is outright unfair in consequence to those who cannot utilize the rune and other roles. Also, all champions who utilize conqueror efficiently have a degree of survivability with the damage output of an assassin, mobility, and DPS greater than an ADC against tanks.

Conqueror offers too many benefits with its synergy with its meta champions and ignores a huge roster - defeating its original purpose and RR.

Jhin abused a bunch of movespeed modifiers+stormrazor damage to make himself virtually impossible to catch/hit while dealing his normal damage which made him OP, the moment his ability to do so was nerfed he was immediately knocked down a few pegs.

Lucian however is a more complex case, because he doesnt really abuse any items or runes,,,,,,he is simply extremely well suited towards  the current meta which lets him perform extremely well.

 
As for kog+lulu,  issue here is basically that kog, varus and ....someone else that i cant recall were absolutely broken with lulu´s auto enhancer ability, tons of free damage for nothing coupled with her defensive skills is what ensured she had to be gutted as kog wasnt the only one affected by her.

Its something that happens because marksmen and supports were intended to work together and the designs meant to capitalize on that which resulted in some pretty broken pairs.
